page.title: 01Bramley Area_general comment
page.content: { Our 12 sq.km.area is neatly divided {by its transport system.}The M18 motorway cuts it in half, North to South, while the A631, a dual carriageway, runs across its East_West axis. In the mid 1950s the outskirts of Rotherham lead west to Wickersley and, then, the village of Bramley. Farmland covered the central area westwards toward Maltby. Today there is Hellaby, the Industrial estate, and development of large estates, towards the motorway from both the Maltby and Bramley side.{In 1985 its about 60% farmland. We went on a walk around Bramley. There are lots of shops and pubs.We saw 3 pubs, one called the Travellers, one called the Ball Inn and the other one called the Joker.In Bramley there are lots of phone boxes and post boxes I think it is a nice place to live.
